meanings.sent1: She wanted to normalise her daily routine by waking up at the same time every morning.
meanings.sent2: After the chaos, things started to normalise in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: Trying to normalise eating ice cream for breakfast would be quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: The therapist helped her normalise her thoughts, turning chaos into order.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a bell to normalise the end of each class, creating a routine for the students.

meanings.definition: To bring or return to a normal condition or state
meanings.sent1: The medicine helped normalise his body temperature after the fever.
meanings.sent2: The storm passed, and the weather slowly started to normalise.
meanings.sent3: It would be funny to normalise wearing pajamas to a fancy dinner party!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a way of normalising the tense atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The music had a calming effect, helping to normalise the mood of the crowd.
